summary: Implement an admin system: backend-maintained admin principal ID list with admin-status checks, plus a frontend admin-management UI. Add the provided principal ID to the admin list.
architectural_notes: Maintain a backend list of admin principal IDs and enforce admin checks for privileged actions.
Provide a frontend UI for managing the admin principal ID list.

existing_features.title: Keep the existing frontend Admin page flow working end-to-end with Internet Identity: a logged-in admin can access the Admin Panel, see an admin-active state, and use the Admin Management panel to grant/revoke admins successfully against the backend admin list.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create backend admin list to store admin principal IDs and support admin-status checking
Add frontend admin-management UI to view/manage admin principal IDs
Add principal ID fxms2-qslpu-4ybaz-kouy4-mpule-mqqq5-7grvy-gyikf-o6pvz-zqvgd-hqe to the backend admin list
Add the principal ID `fxms2-qslpu-4ybaz-kouy4-mpule-mqqq5-7grvy-gyikf-o6pvz-zqvgd-hqe` to the backend’s admin principal list in an additive way (do not remove or replace any existing admins).
Implement a backend query method `isCallerAdmin() : async Bool` that returns whether the caller’s principal is in the persistent admin principal list.
Persist the backend admin principal list across canister upgrades so redeploying/upgrading does not reset or lose the admin list.

Ensure backend admin management operations are fully wired to the persistent admin principal list: `grantAdmin(Principal)` adds the target principal as an admin; `revokeAdmin(Principal)` removes the target principal as an admin; `getAdminsList() : async [Text]` returns the current admin principal IDs and is restricted to admin callers.

projectName: Bootstrap and persist backend admin principal list + enable admin management UI
